p:
Peroxides are formed by the oxidation of fatty acids in oils, these can have adverse effect on quality of oils and food products. Proxidant metals, such as copper and iron, and light, temperature and sensitizers can promote oxidation process. Olive oils have high stability to oxidation and are fit to consume with PV values up to 15 meq O 2/kg oil
21 , but due to its high levels of polyunsaturated fatty acids, linseed oil oxidizes very fast.
